name: Temporal Discord
description: From the legal affairs of multiple iterations of the same individual to violations of the Temporal Accords, the temporal anomaly crisis has turned the legal profession on its head. It'll take a cool head to see justice prevail.
rules:
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- In this Hybrid Event, you will complete Faction Missions in one phase, and Supply Missions in another phase.
-- Unique Federation, Section 31, and Terran Empire Faction Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using Admiral Robert April, any version of Ketoul, Batel, Una, Explorer, or Strange New World crew will provide a bonus to Faction Missions and Supply Missions.
-- Every Faction or Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are also available during Phase 2 only. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Admiral Robert April, Ketoul, Batel, Una, Explorer or Strange New World
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Missions!

featured_crew.name: Chapel
featured_crew.flavor: In the alternate universe, Chapel faces a difficult ordeal: trying to save Spock, but knowing her efforts are likely futile.

action.name: I'm Not Sure That He Will Recover From This

featured_crew.name: Batel
featured_crew.flavor: At the tribunal in the Chin-Riley case, Batel served as prosecutor - reluctantly.

featured_crew.name: Una
featured_crew.flavor: Arrested for concealing her identity as an Illyrian, the tribunal ultimately granted Una asylum and returned her to her post.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Vash
rewards.flavor: A student of archaeology infamous for her ethically questionable practices.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Chapel
rewards.flavor: In the alternate universe, Chapel faces a difficult ordeal: trying to save Spock, but knowing her efforts are likely futile.

action.name: I'm Not Sure That He Will Recover From This

rewards.name: Una
rewards.flavor: Arrested for concealing her identity as an Illyrian, the tribunal ultimately granted Una asylum and returned her to her post.

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: Skill
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 6 Polestars: Command, Diplomacy, Security, Engineering, Science, Medicine

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

adventures.name: Meeting thy Maker
adventures.description: Decide responsibility of those who created synth lifeforms.

adventures.name: Rights Therein
adventures.description: Determine citizenship status for AI and synths.

adventures.name: Raison d'etre
adventures.description: Evaluate the philosophical quandaries of synth life.

adventures.name: Measure of a Machine
adventures.description: Determine the rights and responsibilities of synth life.

rewards.name: Temporal Discord
rewards.flavor: Event Victory Points

rewards.name: Una
rewards.flavor: Arrested for concealing her identity as an Illyrian, the tribunal ultimately granted Una asylum and returned her to her post.

rewards.name: Batel
rewards.flavor: At the tribunal in the Chin-Riley case, Batel served as prosecutor - reluctantly.

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

screens.text: "...and the treatment was helping Counselor Troi. She was finally managing T'Pol's katra just fine. And then her mother stormed in, started throwing around the word 'malpractice', and accusing me of things I won't repeat here."

"Unfortunately you will have to recount everything on the stand and--oh, Captain, glad you answered my hails. As I'm sure you can tell, we're overwhelmed here. Even with the help we've enlisted from other factions, the influx of court cases and legal challenges is never-ending."

"We have the same person from multiple time periods fighting amongst their disparate versions for who has the right to make decisions, clashes between the laws of multiple universes, and let's not even start on the issue of incorporeal rights."
"Well, Captain, do you think you're ready to try your hand at some paralegal work? We could use all the help we can get investigating and addressing all of these cases."

"...and the treatment was helping Counselor Troi. She was finally managing T'Pol's katra just fine. And then her mother stormed in, started throwing around the word 'malpractice', and accusing me of things I won't repeat here."

"Unfortunately you will have to recount everything on the stand and--oh, Captain, glad you answered my hails. As I'm sure you can tell, we're overwhelmed here. Even with the help we've enlisted from other factions, the influx of court cases and legal challenges is never-ending."

"We have the same person from multiple time periods fighting amongst their disparate versions for who has the right to make decisions, clashes between the laws of multiple universes, and let's not even start on the issue of incorporeal rights."
"Well, Captain, do you think you're ready to try your hand at some paralegal work? We could use all the help we can get investigating and addressing all of these cases."
"You would hear the Discovery's computer's case for autonomy and sentience, but not mine? That's at best hypocrisy, but we all know what's really going on here."

"Of course we do! Rights only for those who want to suck up to the Federation and pretend to play to their values! It's clear the Federation doesn't see us all the same. Which is why we should overthrow them and seize power!"

responses.text: "You all really do have your hands full."
"Denied. You all vote the same everytime anyway."

screens.text: "Be silent. Your words are as obsolete as your hardware. We are the Borg, and by sheer number alone, our case should be heard first. Each member of the Collective should be given individual voting rights."

"Zora brought forth a case after being denied a position within Starfleet due to lacking "personhood" and now it's opened the doors wide for a variety of cases regarding AI, synthetic life, Borg drones, and so on. But as you can see, it's far more than we can handle."

"That's an understatement. It's enough to hear one or a handful of cases on difficult matters like sentience and self-determination for AI and synths, but the sheer amount and variety of cases following the one brought by Zora has been untenable."
"Irrelevant. One could say the same for so many in the Federation. And yet you retain your own individual voting rights."

"Captain, we can handle the Borg. Do us a favor and address some of these matters revolving around synthetic life forms and artificial intelligence. Perhaps you can investigate and offer some useful solutions?"
